title: Migration to 3.1.0.Final requires Java version beyond current LTS (17)
body:
### Describe the bug

When running on GraalVM 22.3, JVM LTS version 17 the documented update via `quarkus update`, the process immediately fails with `Unsupported class file major version 63` in Jackson Core.

`quarkus build` also fails with the same error, if `gradle.properties` is manually updated to 3.1.0.Final.

### Expected behavior

Quarkus apps should work on the Java LTS until the new LTS is released, perhaps beyond to allow migration to next LTS.

### Actual behavior

$ quarkus update

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
```posh
A problem occurred configuring root project 'integration'.
> java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: org.gradle.api.GradleException: Failed to create Jar file /Users/thomas/.gradle/caches/jars-9/94ac7eb5f0b504d7e3b47bc2eec907cc/jackson-core-2.15.0.jar.

* Try:
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.

* Exception is:

```

### How to Reproduce?

1. Install current LTS version 17 (e.g., GraalVM 22.3)
2. Install a Quarkus project, which has 2.16.7.Final as current version
3. Project will run with `quarkus dev`
4. Run `quarkus update`
5. Build will fail with `Unsupported class file major version 63`


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin .local 22.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.5.0: Mon Apr 24 20:53:19 PDT 2023; root:xnu-8796.121.2~5/RELEASE_ARM64_T6020 arm64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk 17.0.6 2023-01-17 OpenJDK Runtime Environment GraalVM CE 22.3.1 (build 17.0.6+10-jvmci-22.3-b13) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM GraalVM CE 22.3.1 (build 17.0.6+10-jvmci-22.3-b13, mixed mode, sharing)
